revised_title: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos in Journal Bearings: A Dynamical Systems Approach
tldr: This article explores the complex dynamics and behavior of journal bearings, which are essential components in moving mechanical systems. The authors use numerical integrations and analytical methods to study the effects of cavitation, fluid inertia, and geometrical asymmetries on the motion of the rotor. They reveal a wide range of qualitative behavior and establish the foundations for further investigation using dynamical systems theory.
